Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark 'BEST CANADIAN MOTOR INNS & Design' is clearly descriptive under section 12(1)(b) of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Design elements insufficient to overcome descriptiveness; expert evidence presented but deemed not material
Credibility_Factor: Expert evidence considered but found not material enough to change outcome
Legal_Rule: Section 12(1)(b) prohibits registration of clearly descriptive trademarks
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness in administrative appeal context
Procedural_Issue: Admissibility and materiality of new evidence on appeal
Outcome_on_Merits: Trademark found clearly descriptive and thus unregistrable
Review_Standard: Standard applicable to appeals under section 56 of the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Appeal process followed with opportunity to present new evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Expert testimony on descriptiveness; phonetic rendering of mark as 'BEST CANADIAN MOTOR INNS'
Legal_Framework: Canadian trademark law, administrative appeal procedures
Applicant_Challenge: Registration of 'BEST CANADIAN MOTOR INNS & Design' for hotel and restaurant services
Court_Result: Dismissed appeal, maintained refusal of registration
Defendant_Response: Opposition based on descriptiveness and likelihood of confusion
